elements.name: panel6
elements.title: Determine the sentence structure of the following proverbs and sayings according to the example. Also state whether it is a compound sentence or a sentence structure.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: You have to celebrate the festivals as they fall.
elements.correctAnswer: It can stand alone (is independent); the finite verb comes second.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: When two people quarrel, the third is happy.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Never torture an animal as a joke, because it feels pain like you do.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: As you call into the forest, so it echoes back.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Hard bread is not hard, but no bread is hard.

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Determine the sentence structure of the following proverbs and sayings according to the example. Also state whether it is a compound sentence or a sentence structure.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Where there is a will, there is a way.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Everything has an end, only the sausage has two.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: If you want to reach your destination quickly, go slowly.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: Whoever says A must also say B.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Determine the sentence structure of the following proverbs and sayings according to the example. Also state whether it is a compound sentence or a sentence structure.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Let people talk, because they talk about everyone.

elements.name: question12
elements.title: If you lie once, you won't be believed, even if you speak the truth.

elements.name: question13
elements.title: Tell me who you deal with and I'll tell you who you are.
